title: Miley Cyrus takes massive swipe at ex Liam Hemsworth as she suggests he's 'evil'
text:

Miley Cyrus appeared to take a massive swipe at her ex Liam Hemsworth as she broadcast a live video chat with her new boyfriend Cody Simpson.

Miley and Liam split earlier this year, 10 years after getting together and less than a year after getting married.

She quickly moved on with Brody Jenner's ex Kaitlynn Carter, but is now in a relationship with singer Cody.

As they chatted to each other in an Instagram live stream, Miley shocked fans by saying meeting Cody made her realise she "doesn't need to be gay" and that before meeting him she thought all men were "evil".

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

Miley, 26, said Liam, 29, and her other exes left her with such a bad impression of men that she tried dating girls instead.

She said: "I was being a little too like, I was just being like, I don't know, hardcore feminist vibes and I don't know, not letting anyone in but now I am.

"There are good men out there guys, don't give up, you don't have to be gay, there are good people with d***s out there, you've just got to find them. You've got to find a d**k that's not a d**k, you know what I mean."

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Cody, 22, bursts out laughing as he repeats Miley, saying: "You don't have to be gay."

She continues: "I know, I always thought I had to be gay because I just thought that all guys are evil but it's not true. There are good people out there that just happen to have d***s."

Miley and Cody were chatting live on Instagram after he landed in Sydney amid speculation he's through to the finals of The Masked Singer Australia.

(Image: PA)

The pair went public with their romance on October 4, two months after she announced her split from Liam, who is now dating actress Maddison Brown.
